meanings.def: a chemical element. Iron is a hard strong metal that is used to make steel and is also found in small quantities in blood and food.
examples: iron gates/bars/railings
a hut with a corrugated iron roof
the iron and steel industries
iron ore (= rock containing iron)
foods that are rich in iron
patients with iron deficiency (= not enough iron in their blood)
iron tablets (= containing iron prepared as a medicine)
(figurative) She had a will of iron (= it was very strong).

meanings.def: a tool with a flat metal base that can be heated and used to make clothes smooth
examples: a steam iron
I just need to run an iron over my shirt, then I'm ready.
Use a cool iron on synthetics.

meanings.def: a tool made of iron or another metal
chains or other heavy objects made of iron, attached to the arms and legs of prisoners, especially in the past
examples: leg irons
(old-fashioned) to clap somebody in irons

meanings.def: one of the set of clubs (= sticks for hitting the ball with) that have a metal head
examples: He hit a magnificent shot with a nine iron.

meanings.def: to be involved in several activities or areas of business at the same time, hoping that at least one will be successful
to do exercises in which you lift heavy weights in order to make your muscles stronger
to control a person or a group of people very severely
to make use of an opportunity immediately

idioms.def: to be involved in several activities or areas of business at the same time, hoping that at least one will be successful

idioms.idiom: rule (somebody/something) with a rod of iron
idioms.def: to control a person or a group of people very severely

idioms.idiom: strike while the iron is hot
idioms.def: to make use of an opportunity immediately

meanings.def: to make clothes, etc. smooth by using an iron
examples: He was ironing when I arrived.
iron something I'll need to iron that dress before I can wear it.
Her clothes were always beautifully ironed.
My jeans need ironing.
a neat pile of freshly ironed shirts
She was known as the ‘Iron Lady’.
a man of iron will

meanings.def: if you use the words an iron fist/hand when describing the way that somebody behaves, you mean that they treat people severely. This treatment may be hidden behind a kind appearance (the velvet glove).
examples: They promised that the army would strike with an iron fist at any resistance.
The iron hand in the velvet glove approach seems to work best with this age group.
